Cookie Policy

Understand how we use cookies to enhance your experience and protect your privacy.

Last updated: December 15, 2024
Reading time: 8 minutes
Applies to all users

Table of Contents

Cookie Overview

What This Policy Covers

This Cookie Policy explains how CloudDogg MCP uses cookies and similar tracking technologies on our website and services. It's designed to help you understand what cookies are, how we use them, and how you can control them.

We believe in transparency about the data we collect and how we use it. This policy works alongside our Privacy Policy to give you complete information about our data practices.

Your Control

You have full control over non-essential cookies. Use our interactive cookie manager below to customize your preferences at any time.

What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile) when you visit a website. They help websites remember information about your visit, which can make your next visit easier and the site more useful to you.

Cookie Characteristics

Small Size

Cookies are typically very small files, usually just a few bytes of data

Text-Based

They contain only text information, not executable code or viruses

Domain-Specific

Cookies can only be read by the website that created them

Expiration Dates

Each cookie has an expiration date after which it's automatically deleted

Similar Technologies

We also use similar technologies that work like cookies:

Local Storage

Browser storage that persists longer than session cookies

Session Storage

Temporary storage that's cleared when you close your browser

Web Beacons

Small transparent images used to track email opens and page views

Pixels

Tiny tracking images used for analytics and advertising

Types of Cookies We Use

We categorize our cookies into four main types based on their purpose and functionality:

Essential Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for our website to function properly and cannot be disabled.

Authentication

Keep you logged in and secure your session

Security

Protect against fraud and security threats

Load Balancing

Distribute traffic across our servers for optimal performance

Cookie Consent

Remember your cookie preferences

Functional Cookies

These cookies enhance your experience by remembering your preferences and settings.

User Preferences

Theme, language, and display settings

Course Progress

Your learning progress and bookmarks

Form Data

Temporarily save form inputs to prevent data loss

Accessibility

Remember accessibility settings and preferences

Analytics Cookies

Help us understand how visitors interact with our website to improve user experience.

Usage Statistics

Track page views, session duration, and user flows

Performance Monitoring

Identify slow-loading pages and technical issues

A/B Testing

Test different versions of pages to improve user experience

Error Tracking

Identify and fix bugs and technical problems

Marketing Cookies

Used to deliver relevant advertisements and measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.

Ad Personalization

Show you relevant ads based on your interests

Campaign Tracking

Measure the effectiveness of our marketing efforts

Retargeting

Show you relevant ads on other websites

Social Media Integration

Enable sharing and social media features

Why We Use Cookies

We use cookies for several important purposes that benefit both you and our service:

1

Essential Functionality

Enable core features like user authentication, security, and basic site operations

2

Personalization

Customize your experience based on your preferences and past interactions

3

Performance Optimization

Monitor and improve site performance, loading times, and user experience

4

Analytics & Insights

Understand how users interact with our site to make data-driven improvements

5

Security & Fraud Prevention

Protect against malicious activities and ensure secure transactions

6

Marketing & Communication

Deliver relevant content and measure the effectiveness of our communications

Legitimate Interests

We process cookies based on your consent (for non-essential cookies) and our legitimate interests in providing and improving our services (for essential cookies).

Third-Party Cookies

External Services

Some cookies on our site are set by third-party services we use to enhance functionality and analyze usage. These services have their own privacy policies.

Analytics Services

Google Analytics

Provides detailed website analytics and user behavior insights

Hotjar

Offers heatmaps and user session recordings for UX optimization

Mixpanel

Tracks user events and conversion funnels

Marketing Services

Facebook Pixel

Tracks conversions from Facebook advertising campaigns

Google Ads

Measures effectiveness of Google advertising campaigns

LinkedIn Insight Tag

Tracks professional audience engagement and conversions

Third-Party Privacy Policies

We recommend reviewing the privacy policies of these third-party services:
  • Google Privacy Policy
  • Hotjar Privacy Policy
  • Facebook Privacy Policy

How to Control Cookies

You have several options for controlling cookies beyond our cookie manager:

Browser Settings

Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings:

Block All Cookies

Prevent all cookies from being stored (may break website functionality)

Block Third-Party Cookies

Allow only cookies from the website you're visiting

Delete Existing Cookies

Remove all currently stored cookies from your browser

Incognito/Private Mode

Browse without storing cookies or browsing history

Browser-Specific Instructions

Chrome

Settings > Privacy and Security > Cookies and other site data

Firefox

Settings > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data

Safari

Preferences > Privacy > Manage Website Data

Edge

Settings > Cookies and site permissions > Cookies and site data

Impact of Blocking Cookies

Blocking essential cookies may prevent our website from functioning properly. Some features may not work as expected if you disable all cookies.

Policy Updates

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for legal reasons.

Notification of Changes

When we make significant changes to this policy, we will:
  • Update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this page
  • Notify you via email if you have an account with us
  • Display a prominent notice on our website
  • Request renewed consent for new cookie categories if required

We encourage you to review this policy periodically to stay informed about how we use cookies.
